Bulgarian Party Issues Congratulatory Statement 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Bulgarian Communist Party (Marxist) made public a statement on Sept. 4 congratulating leader Kim Jong Il on his reelection as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
 The statement said that the Korean people are significantly greeting the 55th anniversary of the DPRK with brilliant successes they have achieved in the struggle to defend the national dignity and sovereignty and achieve prosperity of the country and safeguard peace on the Korean peninsula under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 We will join all the progressive people of the world in expressing continued firm solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to foil the moves of the U.S. and its followers for aggression and provocations, defend global peace and build a reunified great prosperous powerful country, it noted.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
Greetings to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Ugandan vice-president on a visit to the DPRK.
 Ugandan Vice-President Bukenya Gilbert Balibaseka conveyed it to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Sept. 6.

articles.title: Foreigners and Overseas Compatriots Arrive
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Yong Nam 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin sent a message of greetings to Kim Yong Nam on Sept. 4 as regards his reelection as president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
 The president in the message said that he expected Kim to keep cooperating to strengthen friendship and cooperation between the two countries and the two peoples.

articles.title: Personal Letter and Gift to Kim Jong Il
Gift to Kim Jong Il from China
articles.content:
Personal Letter and Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a personal letter and gift from Sam Nujoma, president of Namibia.
 They were conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Ehrenst Ungarikutuke Tjiriange, general secretary of the South West Africa People's Organization of Namibia on a visit to the DPRK on September 7.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from China 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries (CPAFFC).
 It was conveyed to an official concerned on Sunday by President Chen Haoxiao of the CPAFFC on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was presented with a gift by the president of the Hong Kong Hotung Eric on a visit to the DPRK on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by President He Hongzhang on September 7.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
Talks between Vice-Presidents of DPRK and Uganda
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Philip Idro, Ugandan ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on September 7.
 Present there was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 The president had a conversation with the ambassador after receiving his credentials.

articles.title: Meeting Held by Koreans in China
National Association of Koreans in Australia Issues Statement
articles.content:
Meeting Held by Koreans in China
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Koreans in China held a meeting in Beijing on Sept. 3 on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Present there were Jo Yong Hwan, chairman of the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, and Koreans in China and members of the DPRK embassy in Beijing.    
 A letter to leader Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting. That day, the participants saw the DPRK film "The Fatherly Leader together with the Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighters."

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Putin
DPRK Players Prove Successful
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Putin
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory message from Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin on Sept. 4 on his reelection as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
 Putin in the message extended sincere congratulations to  Kim Jong Il on his reelection as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.    
 Assuring Kim Jong Il that he was ready to cooperate with Kim Jong Il in the work to develop the friendly relations between the two countries on the basis of the treaty of friendship, good-neighborliness and cooperation, he wished Kim Jong Il good health and success in his future work for the well-being of the Korean people.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK players gave a good account of themselves in the third AASF Asian Age Group Championships 2003 held in Macao.
 Tokgo Bom and Yun Hui bagged gold medals by displaying high technique in the 16-18 group (duet) of synchronized swimming.    
 Meanwhile, Tokgo Bom finished the runner up in the 16-18 group (single), Wang Ok Gyong and Kim Yong Mi in the 13-15 group (duet) and Wang Ok Gyong in the 13-15 group (single).
